title: Ticket #6541: Default campus factory config interferes with other BOSCO uses
description:
Marco opened an OSG ticket about 60-campus_factory.config being bad default config that doesn't make sense for many condor configs. Since it's a nightmare to format text in gittrac, his original description follows in plain text:

The file 60-campus_factory.config is included in condor-bosco.

This file changes security, ports and running daemons configurations that interfere with systems that use BOSCO but are not running a campus factory: e.g. GlideinWMS Factory, BOSCO installations, people installing condor-all...

The file could be removed after the installation but comes back at each update

I was wondering if it could be moved to a separate package or a least not override admin changes with updates.

A workaround at the moment is to remove it and replace it with an empty file.

Thanks
